description.S1: Zora has asked you to investigate an old relay station that has been overrun by monsters.
description.S2: She hopes to find answers to the mystery of the Amber Heights massacre.

blurb.B1: You will obtain this quest after completing Pay for the Printer.
blurb.B2: Follow Zora Blackwood to the medical building and talk to her.
blurb.B3: She will reveal that she thinks the Amber Heights Massacre was engineered by someone who gave the pirates access to the gate codes.
blurb.B4: Agree to help and you'll unlock the quest Sucker Bait.

description.S1: Zora thinks the codes she gave you are to the relay station's entrance

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Hey, Captain. I need your help, and we oughta keep it hush-hush.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: You know about what happened here, right? The history of Amber Heights?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: No. Fill me in.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Years ago - almost a decade, come to think of it - the executives running MSI lived here. If you can believe it, Amber Heights was a residence for decadent high-class types.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: When the other corporations started pulling out, the planet was... chaotic. People got lost in the shuffle. Lot of equipment failures. Lot of death.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Pirates ransacked Amber Heights. Killed the execs, their families... took off with whatever they could carry. We're talking a hundred innocent people.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Wow. Pirates? Did anyone ever catch them?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: That's awful.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: No. We think they used an old relay station near here as a recon point, but nobody ever found them.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: The station's locked up, but one of my people found an old data cartridge in a nearby rapt nest.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: It's mostly corrupted, but I pulled a couple codes off of it. One is the code to the Amber Heights gate. I don't recognize the other, but it's similar. I'd bet it opens a door.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: A random door code doesn't sound useful.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: The Amber Heights gate?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Why are we keeping this to ourselves?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I don't get what's so important about this. Don't you have bigger problems?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Ok. Go to the relay station. See if the code's useful. Anything else?

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: I know it's a long shot, but... if we missed something there, if you can get into that station... maybe we can get some answers.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Right. The access codes to Amber Heights. What gets me is... if this belonged to the pirates, that means they knew someone there.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: If someone gave them the gate code... all those deaths, Captain. All that blood is on their hands.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Graham isn't fond of talking about the history here. He had friends who worked here. The massacre hit him pretty hard.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: You know him. Live and let live and all that. I don't want to burden him right now, especially if this ends up being a dead end.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: I surely do, but it's not far, and if they died in there, they died with their munitions. We'll need them.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Besides, if it's filled with valuables from the aristocrats who lived here, we can pawn 'em off on SubLight and get ourselves ahead on our food budget.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Just a warning. The area's infested with mantisaurs. I'd send some help, but we're, you know, preparing for war.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Right. I'm on it.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'll consider it, but no promises.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Appreciate it. Here's the code. If it works, bring back anything you find. Supplies are best, but information's good, too.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: If someone was behind the Amber Heights massacre, it'd give a lot of people around here some closure to find out who and string them up.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Good luck. Watch out for the pteros.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Sure. I'll be here if you change your mind.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Right. Common belief is that the pirates fled to an old relay station that'd already been abandoned, but nobody could find them.
